info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 9:15AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A MIXTURE OF RAIN, FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET FOR THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN tEXAS PANHANDLE AND THE EASTERN OKLAHOMA PANHANDLE... An area of freezing rain and sleet continues to develop and spread north and east from the south central Texas Panhandle across much of the central and parts of the eastern Texas Panhandle. Some thunder may accompany the sleet and freezing rain. Some light accumulations of ice may form on bridges and overpasses and make driving slick. The sleet and freezing rain will continue moving east and north this morning and should then mix with some light rain if temperatures are near or just above freezing. Otherwise, sleet and freezing rain will be the dominate weather type. Use caution when driving this morning and allow for plenty of time to reach your destination. This wintry mix of precipitation is expected to end by midday today or early this afternoon.
